table_metadata.title: Reference: Department Code List
table_metadata.description: These department codes are maintained in the City's financial system of record. Department Groups, Divisions, Sections, Units, Sub Units and Departments are nested in the dataset from left to right. Each nested unit has both a code and an associated name. The dataset represents a flattened tree (hierarchy) so that each leaf on the tree has it's own row. Thus certain rows will have repeated codes across columns. Data changes as needed.

query: SELECT date_trunc_ym(data_as_of) as Month, sum(Amount) as Sum_Amount, Organization_Group, Department, Program, Character, Object, Sub_Object, Fund_Type, Fund, Fund_Category, Revenue_or_Spending WHERE data_as_of>='2022-09-01' GROUP BY Month, Organization_Group, Department, Program, Character, Object, Sub_Object, Fund_Type, Fund, Fund_Category, Revenue_or_Spending

column_metadata.description: Month the data was updated in the source system.
The sum of the amount earned (Revenue) or spent (Spending) by the City and County of San Francisco.
Org Group is a group of Departments. The Public Protection Org Group includes Police, Fire, Adult Probation, District Attorney, and Sheriff.
Departments are the primary organizational unit used by the City and County of San Francisco.
A program identifies the services a department provides.
In the type hierarchy, Character is the highest level. For example, salaries, benefits, contractual services, and materials & supplies.
In the type hierarchy, Object is the middle level. For example, Permanent Salaries, Temporary Salaries, and Overtime pay.
In the type hierarchy, Sub-object is the lowest level. For instance, overtime for nurses from overtime for police officers and fire fighters.
In the Fund hierarchy, Fund Type is the highest level. It groups Funds according to governmental accounting standards.
In the Fund hierarchy, Fund is the middle level.
In the Fund hierarchy, Fund Category is the lowest level. It groups activity by their characteristics like Operating, Annual Projects, Continuing Projects, Grants, Interdepartmental/Work Order.
Identifies whether the funds are Revenue or Spending.

table_metadata.title: Spending and Revenue
table_metadata.description: The San Francisco Controller's Office maintains a database of spending and revenue data sourced from it's citywide financial system. This data is available from fiscal year 2000 forward.

whom_it_may_interest: This data is useful to anyone interested in the budget and other financial concerns of the city. Examples include residents wanting to understand where their tax dollars are spent, journalists writing about city finance, non-profits or NGOs seeking to understand funding and spending trends, and policy analysts and makers in other cities looking to compare or understand San Francisco's fiscal policies and decisions.
title: Spending and Revenue

table_metadata.title: SFEC Form 3209b - Notification of Recusal Filings
table_metadata.description: Any  member  of  a  City  board  or  commission  other  than  a  member  of  the  Board  of  Supervisors  (See Campaign  and  Governmental  Conduct  Code  Section  3.209(c))  who  is  required  to  file  a  statement  of  economic interests pursuant to Article III, Chapter 1 of the Campaign and Governmental Conduct Code must file form 3209b each time the member recuses him or herself from a matter being considered by the board or commission.  Form 3209b is due within 15 calendar days after the date of the meeting at which the recusal occurred and must be accompanied by a copy of the meeting agenda containing the item that triggered the recusal.

whom_it_may_interest: This dataset may be of particular interest to analysts and researchers interested in patterns of recusal among San Francisco city board and commission members. It can provide insights into when and why recusals happen, which could be instrumental for formulating and testing theories about political behavior, conflicts of interest, and decision-making processes in the city government.
filename: SFEC Form 3209b - Notification of Recusal Filings.json
title: SFEC Form 3209b - Notification of Recusal Filings

table_metadata.title: Privately Owned Public Open Spaces
table_metadata.description: Privately-owned public open spaces (POPOS) are publicly accessible spaces in forms of plazas, terraces, atriums, small parks, and even snippets which are provided and maintained by private developers. In San Francisco, POPOS mostly appear in the Downtown office district area. Prior to 1985, developers provided POPOS under three general circumstances: voluntarily, in exchange for a density bonus, or as a condition of approval. The 1985 Downtown Plan created the first systemic requirements for developers to provide publicly accessible open space as a part of projects in C-3 Districts. The goal was to “provide in the downtown quality open space in sufficient quantity and variety to meet the needs of downtown workers, residents and visitors.” (See Planning Code Section 138 for regulations). Since then, project sponsors for residential projects may provide POPOS instead of their required open spaces in the Downtown Residential (DTR) and Eastern Neighborhoods (Section 135 of the Planning Code). Learn more at http://sf-planning.org/privately-owned-public-open-space-and-public-art-popos

whom_it_may_interest: This data is most likely to be of interest to city planners, real estate developers, residents, workers and visitors in downtown San Francisco. It provides valuable insights into the distribution and characteristics of publicly accessible open spaces, allowing stakeholders to better understand trends and locate potential gaps in provision.
title: Privately Owned Public Open Spaces

whom_it_may_interest: This dataset may interest financial analysts, economists, researchers, and policy makers who are interested to study the investements and income sources of the city officials, as it can provide insights into potential conflicts of interest and patterns in economic behaviour.
filename: Form 700 Schedule A2 - Investments, Income, and Assets of Business EntitiesTrusts.json
title: Form 700 Schedule A2 - Investments, Income, and Assets of Business Entities/Trusts
Campaign Finance - State Filer Data
assistant_reply:
{
    "DateFields": ["month"],
    "NumericFields": ["transaction_sum"],
    "CategoryFields": ["committee_name", "form_type"],
    "endpoint": "3n88-2rrb.json",
    "query": `
        SELECT 
            date_trunc_ym(filing_date) AS month, 
            sum(transaction_amount) AS transaction_sum, 
            committee_name, 
            form_type
        WHERE filing_date>='2022-09-01'
        GROUP BY 
            month, 
            committee_name, 
            form_type
        ORDER BY 
            month, 
            committee_name, 
            form_type`,
    "report_category": "Economy",
    "usefulness": 3,
    "column_metadata": [
        {
            "fieldName": "filing_date",
            "description": "Date the filing was received by SOS",
            "dataTypeName": "text"
        },
        {
            "fieldName": "transaction_amount",
            "description": "Dollar value of transaction. Depending on transaction type this could represent an increase or decrease to committee funds. For Loans refer to Loan Amount columns, for Accrued Expenses refer to Expn columns.",
            "dataTypeName": "number"
        },
        {
            "fieldName": "committee_name",
            "description": "Name of the committee filing",
            "dataTypeName": "text"
        },
        {
            "fieldName": "form_type",
            "description": "Form/Schedule the transaction was reported on, which also represents the kind of transaction. See dataset Description for more.",
            "dataTypeName": "text"
        }
    ],
    "table_metadata": {
        "title": "Campaign Finance - State Filer Data",
        "description": "This dataset contains data from financial statements of state committees that (1) contribute to or (2) receive funds from a San Francisco committee which was Primarily Formed for a local election, or (3) filed a Late Reporting Period statement with the SFEC during the 90 days before an election. The search period for financial statements begins two years before an election and runs through the next semi-annual filing deadline.",
        "endpoint": "3n88-2rrb",
        "category": "Economy"
    },
    "periodic": true,
    "whom_it_may_interest": "The output data from this dataset would hold value for political analysts, economists, journalists, political campaign managers and any interested parties in state finance related to elections."
}

query: SELECT date_trunc_ym(filing_date) AS filing_month, date_trunc_ym(period_start) AS period_start, date_trunc_ym(period_end) AS period_end, filer_name, department_name, position_name, transaction_type, count(*) AS item_count WHERE filing_date>='2022-09-01' GROUP BY filing_month, period_start, period_end, filer_name, department_name, position_name, transaction_type ORDER BY filing_month

column_metadata.description: Date of the filing
Start period of this filing
Ending period of this filing
Name of the filer
Department name of the filer
Filer's position
The schedule this comment is attached to
Count of items grouped by month

table_metadata.title: Form 700 comments
table_metadata.description: This dataset contains records from the comments sections across electronic Form 700 filings with the SFEC since January 1, 2014.

whom_it_may_interest: Policy makers, Researchers, Journalists and Citizens interested in understanding financial disclosures made by city officials
title: Form 700 comments

query: SELECT date_trunc_ym(calculated_date) AS month, filer_name, filing_date, filing_start_date, filing_end_date, transaction_amount_1, transaction_amount_2, filing_type, filer_type, form_type, transaction_description, transaction_code, count(*) AS item_count WHERE calculated_date >= '2022-09-01T00:00:00' GROUP BY month, filer_name, filing_date, filing_start_date, filing_end_date, transaction_amount_1, transaction_amount_2, filing_type, filer_type, form_type, transaction_description, transaction_code

column_metadata.description: This column is the 'most-appropriate' date for the transaction.
Committee name at time of filing
Amount of transaction
Cumulative Amount Year-To-Date
Transaction Description
Transaction expense code

table_metadata.title: Campaign Finance - Transactions
table_metadata.description: Transactions from FPPC Forms 460, 461, 496, 497, and 450 combined with all schedules, pages, and includes unitemized totals from the 'most recent' version of a filing (original/amendment)

whom_it_may_interest: Political Analysts, Campaign Strategists, Campaign Finance Researchers, Journalists
title: Campaign Finance - Transactions

query: SELECT date_trunc_ym(collision_datetime) AS month, sum(number_injured) AS injured_sum, sum(number_killed) AS killed_sum, primary_rd, secondary_rd, collision_severity, type_of_collision, police_district WHERE collision_datetime >= '2022-09-01' GROUP BY month, primary_rd, secondary_rd, collision_severity, type_of_collision, police_district

column_metadata.name: Month
column_metadata.description: Month when the crash occurred

column_metadata.name: Injured Count
column_metadata.description: Count of injured individuals in the month

column_metadata.name: Killed Count
column_metadata.description: Count of killed individuals in the month

column_metadata.name: Primary Road
column_metadata.description: The road the crash occurred on

column_metadata.name: Secondary Road
column_metadata.description: A secondary reference road that distance and direct are measured from

column_metadata.name: Severity
column_metadata.description: The injury level severity of the crash (highest level of injury in crash)

column_metadata.description: Type of the crash

column_metadata.description: Police district where the crash happened

table_metadata.title: Traffic Crashes Resulting in Injury
table_metadata.description: This table contains all crashes resulting in an injury in the City of San Francisco.

whom_it_may_interest: City of San Francisco's Traffic Management department, Road Safety Officers, Civic Planners, Researchers studying traffic safety and patterns, Media reporting on road safety incidents, Public interested in the road safety in their neighborhoods

query: SELECT OPEN_DATE AS OpenDate, CLOSE_DATE AS CloseDate, PROJECT_DECISION_DATE AS ProjectDecisionDate, NUMBER_OF_UNITS_NET AS NumberOfUnitsNet, NUMBER_OF_MARKET_RATE_UNITS_NET AS NumberOfMarketRateUnitsNet, NUMBER_OF_AFFORDABLE_UNITS_NET AS NumberOfAffordableUnitsNet, PROJECT_NAME AS ProjectName, DESCRIPTION As Description, RECORD_STATUS AS RecordStatus, PROJECT_ADDRESS As ProjectAddress, APPLICANT AS Applicant, PROJECT_DECISION AS ProjectDecision WHERE OPEN_DATE >= '2022-09-01T00:00:00' GROUP BY OpenDate, NumberOfUnitsNet, NumberOfMarketRateUnitsNet, NumberOfAffordableUnitsNet, ProjectName, Description, RecordStatus, ProjectAddress, Applicant, ProjectDecision ORDER BY OPEN_DATE

column_metadata.description: Date the record was created
Date the record was closed
Project decision date
Project Feature: total number of dwelling units
Project Feature: number of market rate dwelling units
Project Feature: number of affordable dwelling units
Record name
Record description
Record status
Street Address
Applicant's name
Project decision

table_metadata.title: Planning Department Records - Projects
table_metadata.description: This dataset is a list of projects and project data captured by PRJ records from the Planning Department's Accela database

whom_it_may_interest: This dataset may interest parties who are interested in housing and planning, including developers, urban planners, and policymakers.

query: SELECT date_trunc_ym(readperiod) AS month, sum(totalusage) AS sum_total_usage, utilitytypeabbrev AS utility_type, meterid AS meter_id, servicelocation AS service_location WHERE readperiod>='2022-09-01' GROUP BY utility_type, meter_id, service_location, month

readperiod.description: Date when the reading is performed

table_metadata.title: Airport (SFO) Monthly Utility Usage And Revenue
table_metadata.description: San Francisco International Airport Report on Monthly utility usage and revenues by utility type and meter number

whom_it_may_interest: This data may be of interest to economists, city planners, and environmental scientists studying trends in utility usage and identifying areas of potential savings or need for optimization. Businesses operating at SFO may also be interested to review and better plan their utility usage.

title: Airport (SFO) Monthly Utility Usage And Revenue

query: SELECT date_trunc_ym(Proposal_Date) AS Proposal_Date, count(*) AS item_count, Contractor_Name, Contractor_Type WHERE Proposal_Date>='2022-09-01' GROUP BY Proposal_Date, Contractor_Name, Contractor_Type

column_metadata.description: The unique ID of the filing, generated automatically by DocuSign
Name of Contractor/Subcontractor listed in the proposal
Contractor or Subcontractor
Date proposal was submitted to City Agency

table_metadata.title: SFEC Form 126f2 - Named Parties
table_metadata.description: This dataset contains the names of all contractors and subcontractors that are listed in City contract proposals on SFEC Form 126f2 - Notification of Submission of Proposal filings.

whom_it_may_interest: This data may interest economists, city planners, contractors, subcontractors and anyone interested in San Francisco's economic activities, specifically those related to contract proposals.
title: SFEC Form 126f2 - Named Parties

query: SELECT ownership_name, dba_name, naics_code, naics_code_description, business_corridor, date_trunc_ym(business_start_date) as business_start_month, count(*) as item_count WHERE business_start_date>='2022-09-01' GROUP BY ownership_name, dba_name, naics_code, naics_code_description, business_corridor, business_start_month

table_metadata.title: Registered Business Locations - San Francisco
table_metadata.description: This dataset includes the locations of businesses that pay taxes to the City and County of San Francisco. Each registered business may have multiple locations and each location is a single row.

whom_it_may_interest: This dataset might be of interest to economic analysts, businesses interested in market analysis, city planners, policy makers and entrepreneurs wanting to understand the business trends and economic landscape of San Francisco.
title: Registered Business Locations - San Francisco

query: SELECT Permit_Type, Permit_Status, sum(Permit_Fee) as Permit_Fee, date_trunc_ym(Permit_Application_Date) as Month, count(*) as Total_Count WHERE Permit_Application_Date>= '2022-09-01' GROUP BY Permit_Type, Permit_Status, Month

column_metadata.description: Type of the Permit
Status of the Permit
Fee for the Permit
Date the Permit was applied for

table_metadata.title: Fire Permits
table_metadata.description: Information on Fire Permits issued by the Fire Department for a particular location.

whom_it_may_interest: This dataset would be interesting to any stakeholders in public safety like city planners, fire department officials, policy developers, real estate developers, and residents. It can provide insights on how the number of fire permits correlates with fire safety efforts or other factors that might affect safety in different regions of the city.
title: Fire Permits

query: SELECT date_trunc_ym(data_as_of) AS month, STOPNAME AS stop_name, SUPERVISOR_DISTRICT AS supervisor_district, POSITION AS position, ORIENTATION AS orientation, COUNT(*) AS stop_count WHERE data_as_of>='2022-09-01' GROUP BY month, stop_name, supervisor_district, position, orientation ORDER BY stop_count DESC

column_metadata.description: Timestamp when data was last processed
Location of the stop
The district where the stop is located
Position of the stop
Orientation of the stop

table_metadata.title: Muni Stops
table_metadata.description: Provides location and feature data of all transit stops. Data is updated by 'Sign-up', when transit system changes are put into effect. Updates range from every 3-6 months.

whom_it_may_interest: This data may be useful to city planners, SFMTA officials, and researchers interested in public transportation trends and usage patterns.
title: Muni Stops

query: SELECT date_trunc_ym(date_of_death) AS month_of_death, sum(new_deaths) AS new_deaths_sum, sum(cumulative_deaths) AS cumulative_deaths_sum, max(data_as_of) AS data_as_of, max(data_loaded_at) AS data_loaded_at WHERE date_of_death >= '2022-09-01' GROUP BY month_of_death ORDER BY month_of_death

column_metadata.description: Date of death
Count of deaths on specified date
Cumulative deaths as of specified date
Timestamp for last update date in source system
Timestamp when data entered socrata system

table_metadata.title: COVID-19 Deaths Over Time
table_metadata.description: This dataset represents San Francisco COVID-19 related deaths by day. Data updates as more information becomes available. Because of this, death totals for previous days may increase or decrease. More recent data is less reliable.

whom_it_may_interest: This dataset may interest public health officials, epidemiologists, researchers studying COVID-19 trends, and the general public wanting to know about the impact of COVID-19 in San Francisco.
title: COVID-19 Deaths Over Time
